title: Gangland widow Roberta Williams has bail conditions relaxed after threatening to kill TV producer
text:
Gangland widow Roberta Williams' bail conditions have been relaxed as she faces accusations of threatening to kill a TV producer.

The widow of murdered underworld figure Carl Williams successfully applied to have her bail conditions eased in Melbourne Magistrates Court on Monday.

The 50-year-old is one of several people charged with attacking Ryan Naumenko in Collingwood, an inner-suburb of Melbourne, on July 9.

Gangland widow Roberta Williams (pictured) is seen arriving to Melbourne Magistrates Court on Monday

Roberta Williams' bail conditions have been relaxed as she faces accusations of threatening to kill a TV producer

The TV producer was allegedly kicked, punched and tied up with a power cord.

Magistrate Simon Zebrowski agreed that Williams now reports to police four times a week instead of daily and has curfew exemptions, meaning she can stay out overnight if she's with her partner or children.

Prosecutors did not oppose the application.

Williams faces allegations including making threats to kill, deprivation of liberty and false imprisonment.

James Harrison and Jake Sexton are among the others also charged with the attack on Mr Naumenko.

He was allegedly told 'righto Ryan, you're f***ed. It's all over now,' the court was previously told.

'Roberta wants money otherwise you're f***ed.'

Williams screamed 'kill the c*** ... he is no use to us anymore,' according to police.

Pictures showed Roberta, the widow of Carl Williams, being led from a home in handcuffs and being put into a police car in August

Ryan Naumenko, 36, went public with the allegations against Williams. He showed off his injuries to a television reporter

The 50-year-old is one of several people charged with attacking Ryan Naumenko in Collingwood, an inner-suburb of Melbourne

A committal hearing for the matter is scheduled for May.

Williams was charged on August 7 after a series of co-ordinated raids, where she was taken in handcuffs and put into a police car.

A television crew was waiting outside upon her arrest, with one reporter approaching Williams for a comment.

The Channel 9 reporter was told to 'f**k off' as the convicted criminal was bundled into a police van.

Her daughter to Carl - Dhakota - was later filmed leaving the property with a young child.

Williams along with James Harrison and Jake Sexton, accused of threatening to kill the producer of Williams' reality TV show on July 9

Williams allegedly hired him to create the reality program based on her family.

In a promotional video on the GoFundMe site, Williams declared: 'Wait to see the real me. Get to know me before you judge me. See the person I am then judge me. Then I will take your comments your criticism and won’t even complain.'

Williams had been peddling the 'Mob Wives' take-off since 2017 when she claimed to have filmed the pilot.

She allegedly met Naumenko through an Instagram account three months ago where she enlisted his help for her reality project as producer and narrator.
description: The widow of murdered underworld figure Carl Williams successfully applied to have her bail conditions eased in Melbourne Magistrates Court on Monday.
authors: Lauren Ferri For Daily Mail Australia
